Articles.Content: Been playing since KSP 1 Early Access, but finally decided to get in on the forums (I haven't done things on a bbs/message board in almost 20 years LOL). In terms of space games, I'm mostly over involved with the SciFi end of things, but I keep coming back to send the best skyward in KSP1 and am going with the slight learning curve with KSP2.

Welcome to the forum, @DigitalEva. I, too, played KSP (Original) in the days of EA (0.18), but, to be honest with you, KSP2's learning curve is pretty steep. Your self-description could accurately describe more than 2/3 of us here - we love sci-fi and keep launching things in KSP1 until KSP2 gets better...
Welcome aboard, and be sure to share some screenshots of what you make in either game. We love to see 'em!

Hi @DigitalEva

As you've been through the KSP 1 roadmap, you have a good inkling on how things will progress with KSP 2. It does seem quite different/strange to those of us who have lived with 1 for a good while... but it's a curve worth following IMHO.

And as @adsii1970 says - (or rather the Sirius Cybernetics Corporation did) - Share and Enjoy!

1 hour ago, Vexillar said:

As you've been through the KSP 1 roadmap, you have a good inkling on how things will progress with KSP 2. It does seem quite different/strange to those of us who have lived with 1 for a good while... but it's a curve worth following IMHO.

Oh yeah. I'm eagerly awaiting the upcoming additions!

On 6/12/2023 at 9:44 AM, DigitalEva said:

In terms of space games, I'm mostly over involved with the SciFi end of things

Is there such a thing?
Welcome! May we all have happy launches.
